text: this is Bill Cunningham and on the
street this week I thought it was time
to show you a number of women wearing
these gigantic fake stone necklaces the
really lightweight plastic most of them
so they may look heavy but they were
kind of marvelous and I thought hey the
fourth of July is always capped with
sparklers fireworks and I thought these
if ever there were fashioned fireworks
it's these necklaces and although I
imagine many of the people have purchase
them and God knows how expensive they
are but what i thought was fun was you
could sit on the beach when your sun
tanning and make your own for mismatched
earrings and old brooches just tie them
on to a chain necklace it would be
terrific and where it off to a holiday
weekend fourth of July party and you'd
Sparkle but they intrigued me because
we're fashion women are not indulging in
expensive new clothes the thing to do is
to put all your old jewelry together or
put it all on at once and go out and
have a marvelous time they're just
absolutely marvelous outrageous fakes
and then for the other women I noticed
the whole idea of big cuffs in multiple
bracelets and there was even a designer
a belgian designer and I showed them in
Paris and I thought oh I'll never see
that one and sure enough I saw a woman
in New York and a woman also in Paris
wearing necklaces made from odd
bracelets they just put them over a cord
and tied the cord around their neck I
think it was terrific you know making
use of the things you've got and for
other women of course they wore them
like Lady Nancy Cunard in the
twenties and thirties going right up to
the elbow and what it's all about is
having fun with dressing and not to be
inhibited and think oh I can't wear this
is too much urine sasur that just put it
on and wear it out to a summer potty or
a picnic so have fun whatever you do and
have a sparkly fourth of July
